page.title: 02CUSTOMS (FROYLE/HOLYBOURNE)
page.content: There have been inhabitants at Froyle for 50,000 years,{the name Froyle is {derived from the pagan goddess of {corn, Freya}and no doubt many pagan customs were observed in the far past. More recent local customs have died out as people now go into Alton or Farnham for entertainment at holiday times but for many years the Froyle School children have taken part in Country dancing and have danced round their{Maypole on May Day}and at the village fete. {Foxhounds still hunt {the area occasionally.
